body: found this error `Post https://content.dropboxapi.com/2/files/upload_session/append_v2: http: server closed idle connection`

Found more information

```2017/11/08 03:02:05 DEBUG : pacer: low level retry 1/1 (error Post https://content.dropboxapi.com/2/files/upload_session/append_v2: unexpected EOF)
2017/11/08 03:02:05 DEBUG : file1.mkv: Received error: upload failed: Post https://content.dropboxapi.com/2/files/upload_session/append_v2: unexpected EOF - low level retry 1/10
2017/11/08 03:02:05 DEBUG : pacer: Reducing sleep to 15ms```

Basically on the first error, it restarts from the start, rather than uploading the same "block"
I'm assuming `// FIXME buffer chunks for retries in upload` means that this is a known problem... ARGH!

Yes you are right, that is the all important FIXME!

At the moment we send 128MB chunks but we don't buffer them, so if there is any sort of error then we have to start again.

I've had a go at adding buffering - can you have a go and let me know if it works!  I know it works in the non error case, but if you can see it working retrying a chunk that would be useful confirmation.

https://pub.rclone.org/v1.38-094-gb11f2dd2-dropbox-buffer%CE%B2/

It might be that the 128M default buffer size is too big now...

This one is broken too..


2017/11/08 13:17:54 INFO  : Dropbox root 'mjf14/backups/source/film': Modify window is 1s
2017/11/08 13:18:52 ERROR : file1.mkv: Failed to copy: upload failed: unexpected end of JSON input
2017/11/08 13:18:54 INFO  :
Transferred:   110 MBytes (1.806 MBytes/s)
Errors:                 1
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            0
Elapsed time:      1m0.9s
Transferring:
file2.mkv

when you get a failure now, it just skips it and moves to the next one. This isn't the expected outcome :)

> On 8 Nov 2017, at 5:49 am, Nick Craig-Wood <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> Yes you are right, that is the all important FIXME!
> 
> At the moment we send 128MB chunks but we don't buffer them, so if there is any sort of error then we have to start again.
> 
> I've had a go at adding buffering - can you have a go and let me know if it works! I know it works in the non error case, but if you can see it working retrying a chunk that would be useful confirmation.
> 
> https://pub.rclone.org/v1.38-094-gb11f2dd2-dropbox-buffer%CE%B2/ <https://pub.rclone.org/v1.38-094-gb11f2dd2-dropbox-buffer%CE%B2/>
> It might be that the 128M default buffer size is too big now...
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/1806#issuecomment-342781020>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AApfuHjUfSst0qMxTRKMS9iYPIdNvMcQks5s0YcygaJpZM4QVq3Y>.
>
I needed to reduce the buffer to 10M which worked better also.
I can confirm this has NOT fixed the issue.
@ncw I can give you access to the system to test if that will help.

Update. This version is also presenting this error

```2017/11/09 21:36:46 ERROR : file.mkv Failed to copy: upload failed: lookup_failed/incorrect_offset/.```

> when you get a failure now, it just skips it and moves to the next one. This isn't the expected outcome :)

I really need to see a complete log with `-vv` of the failure.  Feel free to search and replace the file names if you want.

I've figured out what is causing the "unexpected end of JSON input" errors - it is a bug in the dropbox SDK: https://github.com/dropbox/dropbox-sdk-go-unofficial/issues/36

I've thought of a good work-around which I'm going to try - namely retrying all the errors after the first chunk has been uploaded.

I have spent some time investigating this and I've made the large file uploader much more robust.  It can retry segments and it will try harder not to give up.  I've tested it uploading a couple of TB of files with no errors now.

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.38-178-g8357a82e/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
